description: 情态动词表示说话人的态度、情感或语气，不能单独作谓语，必须与动词原形连用

basic_rules: 情态动词 + 动词原形
情态动词没有人称和数的变化
情态动词的否定形式：情态动词 + not
情态动词的疑问形式：情态动词 + 主语 + 动词原形 + ...?

can_could: 表示能力：I can swim. (我会游泳)
表示许可：You can go now. (你现在可以走了)
could是can的过去式，也可表示更委婉的请求
may_might: 表示许可：You may leave now. (你现在可以离开了)
表示可能性：It may rain tomorrow. (明天可能会下雨)
might是may的过去式，表示可能性更小
must: 表示必须：You must finish your homework. (你必须完成作业)
表示肯定推测：He must be at home. (他肯定在家)
should_ought_to: 表示建议或义务：You should study hard. (你应该努力学习)
will_would: 表示意愿：I will help you. (我愿意帮助你)
would是will的过去式，表示更委婉

common_errors: I can to swim. (错误) → I can swim. (正确)
He musts finish his homework. (错误) → He must finish his homework. (正确)
You should to study hard. (错误) → You should study hard. (正确)
usage_tips: 情态动词后必须跟动词原形
情态动词没有人称和数的变化
注意情态动词的否定和疑问形式

can_could: Can you swim across the river?
Could you help me with this bag?
She can play the piano very well.
We can't go out in this weather.
may_might: Might I ask you a question?
She might be late for the meeting.
must: Students must wear uniforms at school.
You mustn't smoke in public places.
He must be at home now.
We must finish this project today.
You must be tired after the long journey.
should_ought_to: Should we invite John to the party?
You ought to apologize to her.
You should see a doctor if you feel sick.
will_would: Will you help me with this?
Would you mind opening the window?
